channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report I-2024100078
item.description:
Report I-2024100078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OAK HARBOR FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While in unload a 55-gal drum was observed with fluid sitting on the top. The liquid was picked up with absorbent and placed in a HM disposal drum. It was believed the liquid came out of the fill cap but both it and bung were found to be secure. The undamaged drum was placed in the HW area and will be disposed of by a licensedÂ· Haz Waster hauler.

item.title: Report I-2024010007
item.description:
Report I-2024010007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-13T00:59:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: Denver
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After recieving UPS innovations shipment- Xray identified lithium metal batteries. shipment was a consolidation of 87 boxes one of which inside a box the batteries were identifed by Xray. Shipment was returned to the shipper- no additional information or pictures other than the outer box were given.
